description: [Status: preview] [Name: no-space-after-inline-comment] [Message: Inline comment should start with #] What it does Checks if one space is used after inline comments. Why is this bad? An inline comment is a comment on the same line as a statement. Per PEP 8, inline comments should start with a # and a single space. Example x = x + 1 #Increment x x = x + 1 # Increment x x = x + 1 # \xa0Increment x Use instead: x = x + 1 # Increment x x = x + 1 # Increment x
